com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class SearchMatchRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianObjectRequest
        • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.SearchRequestBase
          • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.SearchMatchRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataProvider, SiperianObjectUidProvider, Serializable

    public class SearchMatchRequest
extends SearchRequestBase
    Searches for records in a package based on match columns and rule definitions. The SearchMatch API returns the matching records to the caller. It does not create match candidates in the ORS. In order to perform merging or linking for the matching records, the caller has to invoke the Merge, MultiMerge, or Link APIs.

    A match column is a search criteria made up of one or more fields of a base object. A match column can be of type "fuzzy" for matching based on similarity, or type "exact" for strictly verbatim matching.

    For base objects that have fuzzy match enabled, one match column is specified as the "fuzzy match key" match column. The value of this key match column must be specified to process a fuzzy match.

    A combination of match columns can be grouped into a match rule. Matched records that meet all the criteria in a match rule can be considered to be either a definite match or a possible match depending on the match rule type (see MatchType).

    Match rules are further grouped into match rule sets. A rule set can be configured as the default in the Siperian Hub console when there is more than one rule set configured. The SearchMatch API can either be called to use the full set of match columns that are specified, or caller can constrain the search to a single rule set by specifying the rule set using the setMatchRuleSetUid(String) parameter.

    There are multiple options MATCH_TYPE on the API. Here is the relationship between MATCH_TYPE and ruleset. AUTO ï¿½ search using ruleset (if no ruleset passed use default ruleset) only use the autorules from the ruleset BOTH - search using ruleset (if no ruleset passed use default ruleset) NONE ï¿½ generates a dynamic ruleset to search in based on the match columns passed in via the API

    A combination of fuzzy and exact matching can be used. In this case, the fuzzy matching will be performed, and the results further filtered by the exact match columns provided.

    Required Parameters:

    • Match columns or RecordsToMatch
    • SiperianObjectUid - package or base object to be returned.
    • MatchType - By default, the value NONE is used when not specified in the request.

    Optional Parameters:

    • IncludePending
    • SortCriteria
    • MatchRuleSetUid
    • Parameters related to paging

    Match columns can be explicitly set by addMatchColumnField(Field) where Field is a match column name and value to search for. A match column can be specified more than once by adding a Field with the same match column name but different value.

    Alternatively, Records (with fields and values) for packages or a cleanse mappings can be specified in the request, and Hub will figure out which match columns to use. More than one record can be specified. A match column will be used if the record contains values for all of the fields that make up the match column. We recommend using records that map to single base objects rather than packages that join multiple base objects. Multiple types of records can be provided as parameters. For example for a C_CUSTOMER object that has C_ADDRESS object as a child (with correspondent P_CUSTOMER and P_ADDRESS packages configured on top of the BOs) and has match rules configured to use both customer and address information for matching customers, the caller can pass a P_CUSTOMER record and several P_ADDRESS records to search for records matching the input criteria.

    Specifying match column values by calling addRecordToMatch(Record) will override the match columns specified by calling addMatchColumnField(Field). Optionally, the match columns to used can be restricted with addMatchColumn(String).

    Usage Example:

    The following example searches for a record from the package PARTY_ADDRESS_READ_PKG where the match column Organization_Name equals 'JENNIE TERRY':

    SearchMatchRequest request = new SearchMatchRequest();
    request.setRecordsToReturn(5); //Required
    request.setSiperianObjectUid("PACKAGE.PARTY_ADDRESS_READ_PKG"); //Required
    Field orgNameField = new Field("Organization_Name"); //Required match column
    orgNameField.setStringValue("JENNIE TERRY");
    request.addMatchColumnField(orgNameField);
    request.setSortCriteria("NAME DESC");
    SearchMatchResponse response = (SearchMatchResponse) sipClient.process(request);

    See Also:
    SearchMatchResponse, SearchQueryRequest, MergeRequest, MultiMergeRequest, LinkRequest, Serialized Form

    API Pair: SearchMatchResponse

    API Group: Data Retrieval

        public void setMatchType(MatchType matchType)

        Parameters:

      • addRecordToMatch

        public void addRecordToMatch(Record record)
        Alternative to addMatchColumnField(Field), Hub will find match columns based on package or mapping Record Fields. Only and all fields required for the match columns need to be specified. To restrict the match columns to use, see setMatchColumnUids(ArrayList).

        Release XT SP2 required a workaround: append a space to exact match column values - the problem is fixed, so the workaround is no longer needed and will fail to match; also noted in Release Notes.

        Parameters:
        record - Record to add.
        See Also:
        setRecordsToMatch(ArrayList), setMatchColumnUids(ArrayList)

      • getMatchRuleSetUid

        public String getMatchRuleSetUid()
        See corresponding setter method for detail.
        Returns:
        SiperianObjectUid of match rule set; null = use default match rule set.
        See Also:
        setMatchRuleSetUid(String)

      • setMatchRuleSetUid

        public void setMatchRuleSetUid(String matchRuleSetUid)
        A match rule set is a set of auto-merge and/or manual merge match rules defined for a base object.

        Acceptable forms of matchRuleSetUid are:

        • Fully qualified SiperianObjectUid; for example, "MATCH_RULE_SET.C_PARTY|Main"
        • Rule set name, prefixed with parent base object name; for example, "C_PARTY|Main"
        • Rule set name (parent base object name is implied); for example, "Main"

        Parameters:
        matchRuleSetUid - Match rule set; null to use default match rule set.

      • getMatchColumnUids

        public ArrayList getMatchColumnUids()
        See corresponding setter method for detail.
        Returns:
        List of SiperianObjectUid of match columns to generate.

      • setMatchColumnUids

        public void setMatchColumnUids(ArrayList matchColumnUids)
        See description for addRecordToMatch(Record)
        Parameters:
        matchColumnUids - List of String, SiperianObjectUid of match columns to use.
        See Also:
        addMatchColumnUid(String), addRecordToMatch(Record)

      • addMatchColumnUid

        public void addMatchColumnUid(String matchColumnUid)
        Used with addRecordToMatch(Record), MatchColumnUids restrict the match columns that will be used.

        Match column will be added to the list of MatchColumnUids. Only the match columns in this list will be generated, unless the list is empty, in which case all possible match columns will be generated.

        The UID can be in any of the following formats, as long as it is unambiguous:

        • MATCH_COLUMN.baseObject|matchColumnName for example: "MATCH_COLUMN.C_CONTACT|Person_Name" or SiperianObjectType.MATCH_COLUMN.makeUid("C_CONTACT", "Person_Name")
        • MATCH_COLUMN.matchColumnName for example: "MATCH_COLUMN.Person_Name" or SiperianObjectType.MATCH_COLUMN.makeUid("C_CONTACT")
        • baseObject|matchColumnName for example: "C_CONTACT|Person_Name" or SiperianObjectType.makeSiperianObjectName("C_CONTACT", "Person_Name")
        • matchColumnName for example: "Person_Name"
        Parameters:
        matchColumnUid - SiperianObjectUid of match column to add.
        See Also:
        setMatchColumnUids(ArrayList), addRecordToMatch(Record)

      • addMatchColumn

        public void addMatchColumn(String matchColumnUid)

        Whether to include pending records in the search results.

      • setIncludePending

        public void setIncludePending(boolean includePending)
        If True, then include pending records in the results. Otherwise, only active records are returned in the results.

        Parameters:
        includePending - The includePending to set.
